Reminder: Enrollment begins tomorrow at Alton R-IV. New student enrollment for grades Preschool-12th will take place on August 5th and 6th from 9:00-3:00 in the foyer at Alton Elementary. Please bring an immunization record, birth certificate, and proof of residency (utility bill, license, rental agreement, etc.) for all students being enrolled. Parents should also bring copies of any legal documents, such as custody agreements.

In addition, any parent who wishes to enroll his or her child in virtual learning must drop by the school to complete a virtual instruction enrollment form. Parents wishing to homeschool are also required to complete a homeschool form. If you are choosing either option, a form must be completed and submitted by August 6th at 3 pm. Counselors will be on hand in the elementary foyer to assist with this process on August 5th and 6th.

Our 6th Graders traveled to Jefferson City today! We started our day with a visit to the Missouri Supreme Court where Missouri’s first female Supreme Court clerk, Betsy AuBuchon, spoke to our students! Betsy is an Alton graduate so hearing her speak was especially inspiring to our students! Our students were proud to learn that she walked the same halls that they do each day! Next, we went to the state capital. Students learned so much about our state’s history! While at the capital, we enjoyed lunch provided to us by Betsy AuBuchon. We finished the day with a trip to the historical Missouri State Penitentiary. This tour proved to be one of the most interesting parts of our day!

We had a great day and can’t wait to take future students on this special trip!

*Thank you to Brenda Ledgerwood and Diana Clary for helping to make today possible for our students.

Mrs. Willard is a vital asset to our school district and we cannot thank her enough for all that she does!

The 2020 Missouri Public Affairs Academy is a summer program on the campus of MSU in Springfield. It brings together talented high school juniors from throughout the state to explore leadership skills along with the practices of civic engagement and service. Participants will spend eight days on the Missouri State University campus, all expenses paid, engaging in a variety of activities designed to nurture leadership skills and to enhance civic knowledge, skills, and dispositions. Participants will dialogue with leaders in politics, the media, and the community and will travel to Jefferson City for a day to meet with state elected officials. Academy activities include discussions, presentations, service projects, and more.

This year’s Academy will be held from July 11-July 18, 2020. The application postmark deadline is March 1, 2020. To be accepted to the Academy, students must meet the following criteria:
Current junior in high school
3.0 GPA
willingness and availability to attend the entire eight-day Academy

The Alton R-IV School District would like to say thank you to the Oregon County Sheriff’s Department and the Alton Police Force for their service. Today, elementary students honored local law enforcement with a luncheon catered by Alton Burger Palace. We were so grateful to have some of our favorite officers stop by and visit!

The Alton Comets would like to especially say thank you to our very own School Resource Officer, Mr. Chris Walker. Officer Walker is one of the most valuable members of our team at Alton R-IV. This man works his hardest to protect our students from daylight until dark each and every day! He spends an unfathomable amount of hours patrolling our campus. Officer Walker never stops! He will do whatever it takes to protect our students! We are so grateful to have Mr. Walker at Alton R-IV. His presence has positively impacted our district in so many ways and he has made our school a safer place. From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you, Officer Walker!!! #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay #WeLoveOurSRO
